SENT.plain: Atheromatous stenosis of the intracranial arteries is a major cause of ischemic cerebral events
To date, treatment has been medical
Percutaneous balloon angioplasty can be used to dilate intracranial arterial stenosis with an 80% success rate
This technique is still under evaluation but can be indicated in symptomatic patients after failure of a well-conducted anti-thrombotic regimen
